html: (2 Nephi 7:3)."Clothe the heavens with blackness, and I make sackcloth their covering." One of the plagues the Lord inflicted on Pharaoh's Egypt was to cover the land with darkness. (Exodus 10:21-23.) Footnote references in the Book of Mormon text identify Revelation 6:12 as a possible future fulfillment of this prophecy, when "the sun [shall become] black as sackcloth." (See also Matthew 24:29; D&C 45:42; BICQ, 183-85.) Sackcloth is a coarse fabric of a dark color and was used in making the garments worn by mourners.
